greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Continued fraction expansion for c=sum_{k>=0} 1/2^(k!).
comment: Observation: if b(k) denotes the sequence of all elements of the continued fraction for c, b(k) = 4095 if k==6 or 19 (mod 24); b(k) = 4722366482869645213695 if k==12 or 37 (mod 48); .... If b(k) is not congruent to 5 (mod 10), it seems that b(k) = 1,2,3 or 4 only.
link: Rick L. Shepherd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..47
Rick L. Shepherd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..383 (has larger terms than b-files support)
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Nov 02 2002
ext: b-file, a-file, PARI program, and corrected conjecture by _Rick L. Shepherd_, Jun 07 2013
